definition: to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: It is said to burn ssbbww. com one fourth of the fuel of conventional diesel-powered cars.
sentences.chinese: 据说这款车的耗油量仅为传统柴油车的四分之一。

sentences.english: By 2020, the Chinese government wants that figure to fall to 5 litres.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府希望到2020年将百公里耗油量降至5升。

sentences.english: This kind of engine uses four times more fuel tha new good that kind does.
sentences.chinese: 这种柴油机胡耗油量比那一种多三倍。

sentences.english: If tires could be improved, automobiles would need less fuel.
sentences.chinese: 如果轮胎得到改进，可使汽车节省耗油量。

sentences.english: Bigger cars tend to be gas guzzlers, and I wanted a bigger car.
sentences.chinese: 现在耗油量大的汽车一定卖不动了吧？

sentences.english: It is said to burn only one fourth of the fuel of conventional diesel-powered cars.
sentences.chinese: 据说这款车的耗油量仅为传统柴油车的四分之一。

definition: dead weight/weight capacity of a vehicle
discharge volume/engine capacity/engine displacement (volume of air fuel mixture drawn in during one cycle)
angular velocity/number of revolutions per minute
